snippet: Bishop David Kagan of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Bismarck has ordered parishes in western North Dakota to sever sponsorship ties with the Boy Scouts of America after the group’s decision to lift its ban on gay adult leaders.
abstract: Bishop David Kagan of Bismarck orders Catholic parishes in western North Dakota to cut ties with Boy Scouts of America after organization decided to lift ban on gay adult leaders.
lead_paragraph: Bishop David Kagan of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Bismarck has ordered parishes in western North Dakota to sever sponsorship ties with the Boy Scouts of America after the group’s decision to lift its ban on gay adult leaders.

headline.main: North Dakota: Bismarck Diocese Cuts Ties to Boy Scouts
headline.print_headline: North Dakota: Bismarck Diocese Cuts Ties to Boy Scouts
